mhd.name: mhd
mhd.description: A Music Hack Day project that ruined music at random.

market-stox.name: market-stox
market-stox.description: This was a failed bot that generated fictional stock symbols and value changes.

get-from-library.name: get-from-library
get-from-library.description: A super basic bookmarklet that will find books in the Minutema n Library Network (a Masschusetts-area group of libraries) so you can ask for them to be brought to your local branch.

godtributes.name: godtributes
godtributes.description:
A bot that posts tributes to befitting each god! It reads (and watches) its followers' tweets for inspiration. This is my most popular bot.

@godtributes is few Node processes. One maintains a database of what it has replied with and to whom and when it did it. Another is a proxy cache to the Wordnik API. Another generates the standalone tribute tweets. Yet another listens to a Twitter stream in real time and generates (or doesn't) tributes based on incoming tweets' text and images.

namedlevels.name: namedlevels
namedlevels.description:
1st Edition Advanced Dungeons & Dragons had a charming quirk in it. Every experience level for every class had a different title. Named Levels is a web app that generates those names for any possible "class" you could think of.

The web app brings together the old and the new in a couple of ways. Obviously, 1st Edition AD&D and its design language are very old, and web apps are fairly new. Less obviously, since these experience tables are literally tables, it uses the long-maligned table tagged! However, in order to make it work with different window and device sizes, it uses the fairly new flexbox and media queries.

botinthestreet.name: botinthestreet
botinthestreet.description:
This bot comes up with different ways to fill out the "___ in the street but a ___ in the sheets" snowclone (originating from "a lady in the street but a freak in the sheets").

It picks a random word, then pairs that word with an antonym, rhyme, or cross-reference from the Wordnik API. It seems like that may be too crude to work, but it turns out that the human mind tries pretty hard to connect the dots when it comes to many things, including innuendo.

sprigot.name: sprigot
sprigot.description: A tree-oriented way of visualizing branching documents written with D3 and Node.

quadtreevis.name: quadtreevis
quadtreevis.description: When I was building my cellular automaton, I wanted to try storing my cells in quadtrees to save space. It was then that I realized I wasn’t that clear on how quadtrees work, so I built this explanation.

backagain.name: backagain
backagain.description: A Chrome extension that tells you how many times you've visited the page you're on, right in the button by the URL. Clicking the button gives you a graph showing how many times you've visited the page in the last week.

nonstopscrollshop.name: nonstopscrollshop
nonstopscrollshop.description: Do you like products? Do you like scrolling? How about infinite scrolling? Well, then! Come on down to Non-Stop Scroll Shop where we'll always have something new for you…forever.

smidgeo.name: smidgeo
smidgeo.description: I took on a side contract to build my cat's corporation's web site. Smidgeo is a business built on growth, digital, social, disruption, a proprietary form of smart marketing known as Smidgeo Smarketing. The bottom line? Smidgeo GETS results.

slack-gis.name: slack-gis
slack-gis.description:
I've written a little web service that lets you search Google Image Search from Slack. I've found it to be a good companion to giphy. Here's the code and instructions to set it up.

This project had two interesting problems: 1) Getting search results from Google is a moving target. I started out using a module that used Google's deprecated image search API, and one day, it just stopped working. I ended up writing my own scraper. 2) A lot of Google image search results point to dead images. When you're on Google itself, that's no big deal. You just move on to the next result. On Slack, it's far more disappointing, since you get only one search result. (Multiple results would be overwhelming.) For that reason, I added result auditing, which made it a slower – but still better – experience.

contingencymsgs.name: contingencymsgs
contingencymsgs.description: @metroidbaby, @NotInventedHere, and I built a Twitter bot that alerts you about various fictional emergency situations.

monthlydamage.name: monthlydamage
monthlydamage.description: Are you trying to buy a house? Well, if so, this tells you how much you'll have to pay each month for it, factoring in taxes and loan terms, so you can immediately find out if a house or condo is just too bonkers for you.

autocompletejok.name: autocompletejok
autocompletejok.description: This bot creates knock knock jokes by hitting up autocomplete on Google. This is perhaps the dumbest bot of all time. And yet! I am compelled to share amazing jokes like these.
links: The best Twitter bots of 2015 on Quartz
Twitter Moments: 10 bots that are better at Twitter than you

massdaycare.name: massdaycare
massdaycare.description:
Work in progress. This is a map of daycare providers available in the state of Massachusetts. I built it because while daycare search was available from the Mass EEC, there was no map-driven way to browse the daycare available in an area.

The data gets to the user like so: A scraper gathers all of the data available from the Mass EEC site but clicking through hundreds of pages as if it was a user. That data undergoes several transforms, including geocoding and validation. Then, it is stored in a LevelDB database that the API server reads. The server streams the daycare provider data to the browser app, which requests it as the user pans over areas containing those providers. It caches them browser-side in an IndexedDB so that it can retrieve them quickly the next time the user uses the app.

phonemelibraries.name: phonemelibraries
phonemelibraries.description:
Phonemenon is a library for phoneme manipulation and analysis. It's a set of functions that lets you do things like find out what syllables are in a word, how commonly certain syllables follow each other or how often given phonemes follow each other.

word-phoneme-map lets you look up words that correspond to phoneme sequences and look up phoneme sequences that correspond to words.

phoneme-sequencer stochastically completes a given partial phoneme sequence by using an analysis of real-world phoneme sequences.

array-viewfinder.name: array-viewfinder
array-viewfinder.description: Maintains a view into an array for you, for paging and other uses.

brush-viewfinder.name: brush-viewfinder
brush-viewfinder.description: An example that establishes a two-way connection between array-viewfinder and a D3 brush control.

filtered-followback.name: filtered-followback
filtered-followback.description: Given Twitter credentials, make follower and followee lists match by following and unfollowing (via quidprofollow), while taking care to not follow probable spam accounts (via twitterjerkdetector).

lsystem.name: lsystem
lsystem.description: A module that lets you create L-systems, which will take rules, then use those rules to transform strings into other strings.

camera.description: A component that lets you add zooming and panning to your SVG-based app.

probable.name: probable
probable.description: Module with utilities for making random table and related things.

phonemenon.name: phonemenon
phonemenon.description: A collection of modules and utilities for doing things with phonemes.

sparse.name: sparse
links: Sparse (you need to turn sound on to hear it)

quadtreemap.name: quadtreemap
quadtreemap.description: Maps D3 quadtrees to show what area each non-leaf in the tree node covers.

csscrown.name: csscrown
csscrown.description: Small utility for granting a CSS class to one selected element and one element only at any given time.

twitter-shuffle-chrome-extension.name: twitter-shuffle-chrome-extension
twitter-shuffle-chrome-extension.description: Chrome extension that shuffles tweets so that they are randomly misattributed.

twittershuffle.name: twittershuffle
twittershuffle.description: Bookmarklet that shuffles tweets so that they are randomly misattributed.

quadtreetree.name: quadtreetree
quadtreetree.description: Displays the internal structure of quadtrees.

quadtreelabeler.name: quadtreelabeler
quadtreelabeler.description: Functions that provide a consistent way to label D3 quadtree nodes and translate them to and from DOM element ids.

commandcenter.name: commandcenter
commandcenter.description: An attempt at a command center for classic movie villain types.

reactivecell.name: reactivecell
reactivecell.description: Cell (as in cellular automata) Node/browser module.

cellmap.name: cellmap
cellmap.description: A quadtree-based cell map that tracks cell neighbors. For use with cellular automata.

roguemap-parse-stream.name: roguemap-parse-stream
roguemap-parse-stream.description: Reads a text map and emits an event for each character in it.

node-module-boilerplate.name: node-module-boilerplate
node-module-boilerplate.description: Skeleton I use for my own node modules.

gravitybox.name: gravitybox
gravitybox.description: Module for the browser that creates a bounded D3 force layout in which each node added has 'gravity' that makes it fall to the bottom of the box, which respecting collisions with other nodes. (Was later used for smidgeo.com/plan, I believe.)

idmaker.name: idmaker
idmaker.description: This module generates random ids that can be used as DOM element ids. That's all. (Wonky in some ways, but has been used basically untouched in many projects since it was created.

basic-browser-request.name: basic-browser-request
basic-browser-request.description: Yet another XHR abstraction. Supports canceling, JSON, and crude chunking. Has been in almost every web app I've made!

cellgridrenderer.name: cellgridrenderer
cellgridrenderer.description: A browser module for rendering grids of cells

flickrset-to-html.name: flickrset-to-html
flickrset-to-html.description: Grabs the photos from a Flickr set and creates html that links to them.

cellseriesviewer.name: cellseriesviewer
cellseriesviewer.description: A small web app that displays series of cells.

scrapeproviderlinks.name: scrapeproviderlinks
scrapeproviderlinks.description: Scrapes Massachusetts EEC (Early Education and Childcare) provider links for relevant childcare provider data.

masschildcaredata.github.io.name: masschildcaredata.github.io

search-index.name: search-index

metafilterfilter.name: metafilterfilter
metafilterfilter.description: Chrome extension that lets you get rid of posts on MetaFilter that you're done with.

tweethook.name: tweethook
tweethook.description: Tweets commits received via GitHub Webhooks.

editize.name: editize
editize.description: A function that makes DOM elements editable.

wardboss.name: wardboss
wardboss.description: wardboss is a dependency injection module. It decides who gets what when they ask for it.

node-ab.name: node-ab
node-ab.description: A command tool to test the performance of HTTP services.

rime.name: rime
rime.description: rime is a module that finds rhymes, including loose rhymes.

rapgamemetaphor.name: rapgamemetaphor
rapgamemetaphor.description: Posts rap boasts / Everyword-style, hits the metaphors / Makes you want some more.

canonicalizer.name: canonicalizer

chronicler.name: chronicler
chronicler.description: A module that creates a persistent topic-centric record of an app's interactions with Twitter users.

conform-async.name: conform-async
conform-async.description: Calls callbacks on next tick, so as to not trip up clients expecting normal async behavior.

wordnok.name: wordnok

emojisource.name: emojisource
emojisource.description: Returns random emoji. Also, filters "boring" emoji.

nounfinder.name: nounfinder
nounfinder.description: Extracts nouns from chunks of text, using the [Wordnik API](http://developer.wordnik.com/docs.html).

autocompleterap.name: autocompleterap

autocompl.name: autocompl
autocompl.description: Wrapper for suggestqueries.google.com queries. Gets the autocomplete suggestions that the Google search bar would give you if you were typing in it.

iscool.name: iscool
iscool.description: Lets you know if a word is cool or not. Current use: Twitter bots.

meedley.name: meedley
meedley.description: Plays riffs and solos in a browser.

dicecup.name: dicecup
dicecup.description: Rolls dice over Twitter and the command line.

better-know-a-tweet.name: better-know-a-tweet

smidgeodice.name: smidgeodice
smidgeodice.description: A bot that will roll dice for you. Not currently running anywhere, but might again someday!

stampy.name: stampy

accessor.name: accessor
accessor.description: Provides accessor functions for convenience in D3 programming. (I use this in every D3 app I make.)

quidprofollow.name: quidprofollow
quidprofollow.description: Makes a Twitter bot's (or human user's) follower and followee lists match by following and unfollowing to make it happen.

twitterjerkdetector.name: twitterjerkdetector
twitterjerkdetector.description: Given an array of Twitter user ids, gives back an array of the subset of those user ids that aren't jerks.

phoneme-types.name: phoneme-types
phoneme-types.description: Classifies phonemes as vowelish or consonantish.

codesampler.name: codesampler
codesampler.description: Samples publicly available code from Github, posts it to Twitter.

url-body-stream.name: url-body-stream

tweet-truncate.name: tweet-truncate

multilevel-cache-tools.name: multilevel-cache-tools

level-cache-server.name: level-cache-server

namedlevels-web.name: namedlevels-web
namedlevels-web.description: This app displays randomly generated classes with old-school named levels (like in 1st Edition AD&D).

namedlevels-api.name: namedlevels-api
namedlevels-api.description: Serves randomly generated old-school 1st Edition AD&D-style classes that have named levels.

urchin.name: urchin
urchin.description: A super basic command line tweet tool that you can use for your bot. Just shell out to it with the tweet you want to post, and it'll post it.

fuck-shit-up-bookmarklet.name: fuck-shit-up-bookmarklet
fuck-shit-up-bookmarklet.description: Sprinkle some 'fucks' into whatever you're reading.

namedlevels-bot.name: namedlevels-bot
namedlevels-bot.description: This is a Twitter bot that posts Named Levels (http://jimkang.com/namedlevels/) excerpts.

simplescroll.name: simplescroll
simplescroll.description: A very simple inertial scrolling module that puts together easing functions and a timer to smoothly scroll the page to where you want it.

trenchant-insights.name: trenchant-insights
trenchant-insights.description: Finds trenchant insights. It went about it by looking for contradictory paths in ConceptNet, but it never quite worked.

materials.name: materials
materials.description: This module is a collection material names. (As strings.)

monsters.name: monsters
monsters.description: This module is a collection of monsters.

material-monsters.name: material-monsters
material-monsters.description: I don't have to explain myself to you!

material-monsters-bot.name: material-monsters-bot
material-monsters-bot.description: Bot that makes up monsters made of different materials and posts them.

collectivizer.name: collectivizer
collectivizer.description: Comes up with collective nouns for things.

sprigot-api.name: sprigot-api

a-tyranny-of-words.name: a-tyranny-of-words
a-tyranny-of-words.description: A bot that posts imagined collective nouns for random nouns. It stopped working when Google Search stopped being (easily) scrapable.

call-next-tick.name: call-next-tick
call-next-tick.description: Calls callbacks on next tick so you can avoid craziness from code that expects async to not execute immediately. (Formerly conform-async.) It's in almost all of my projects.

hail-ants-bot.name: hail-ants-bot
hail-ants-bot.description: Posts news about the inexorable threat to humanity this is ants.

word-phoneme-map.name: word-phoneme-map

tupac-advisory.name: tupac-advisory
tupac-advisory.description: A bot that gives you Tupac-style advice.

word-syllable-map.name: word-syllable-map
word-syllable-map.description: Provides a one-way map from words to the syllables they contain.

whosthereautocomplete.name: whosthereautocomplete
whosthereautocomplete.description: This is a bot that posts autocompleted knock-knock jokes.

twitter-sampler.name: twitter-sampler
twitter-sampler.description: Creates (or updates) a Twitter list comprised of a sampling of all of the users a Twitter user follows.

get-spatial-preposition.name: get-spatial-preposition
get-spatial-preposition.description: Given a word fragment, extracts the spatial preposition, if any are in it.

decent-activity.name: decent-activity
decent-activity.description: A Chrome extension for seeing the haps from your MeFi contacts.

bookmaker.name: bookmaker
bookmaker.description: A project that generated a picture book about an octopus trying to find a friend in space. Most of it were procedurally generated pictures of imaginary places in space. For NaNoGenMo 2018.
links: App to generate the pages (Hit "clear seed" to make a new page)

il-gov-widget-host.name: il-gov-widget-host
il-gov-widget-host.description: Just hosting the ProPublica Illinois governor's race spending widget here.

small-cats-big-fields.name: small-cats-big-fields
small-cats-big-fields.description: Generates big fields with small cats

post-it.name: post-it
post-it.description: Module for convenient posting to static-web-archive, Mastodon, and Twitter.

archive-tfidf.name: archive-tfidf
archive-tfidf.description: Runs TF-IDF (using term-tracker on a static-web-archive whenever there is a new archive page. Optionally posts the results somewhere.

colorer-web.name: colorer-web
colorer-web.description: Colors things! An ongoing exploration of image transformations with adorsk.

term-tracker.name: term-tracker
term-tracker.description: A persistent record of terms used in documents that can be used for TF-IDF analysis or other purposes. The backing store is just a JSON file, which is loaded entirely in memory. It's nice and simple and will work for, say, personal blogs, but it's not for gigabytes of data.

random-internet-archive.name: random-internet-archive
random-internet-archive.description: Gets a random Internet Archive resource, in URL form with some metadata.

run-shotbot.name: run-shotbot
run-shotbot.description: The core of shotbot, a multi-tenant app for bots that post screenshots of web pages.

bot-index.name: bot-index
bot-index.description: Simple index page for my bots, with a tool that builds it.

dungeonmake.name: dungeonmake
dungeonmake.description: Drag-and-drop dungeon maker, meant for making a dungeon *as* you run a game.

mtclaire.name: mtclaire
mtclaire.description: A D&D module in Markdown form, edited with Notable

flame-buddy-sword-assistant.name: flame-buddy-sword-assistant
flame-buddy-sword-assistant.description: What if there were a magic sword? That was free-to-use, but also primarily made to promote a company and to collect data?

you-can-stop-naming-repos-awesome.name: you-can-stop-naming-repos-awesome
you-can-stop-naming-repos-awesome.description: It's no longer necessary to use "awesome" in the names of GitHub knowledge repos!

normalize-objects.name: normalize-objects
normalize-objects.description: Takes an array of objects and makes sure each of them has the same fields.

render-download-link.name: render-download-link
render-download-link.description: Takes a blob and puts a link on the page so that the user can download the contents of that blob.

good-ia-source-image-probable-def.name: good-ia-source-image-probable-def
good-ia-source-image-probable-def.description: A probability table definition (for probable) that yields Internet Archive search params that get decently interesting images for use in art image apps.

audio-context-singleton.name: audio-context-singleton
audio-context-singleton.description: When you want to have an audioContext singleton but don't want to rewrite this small bit of code, use this. Deals with browser differences in AudioContext and maintains the singleton.

play-audio-url.name: play-audio-url
play-audio-url.description: An abstraction for playing audio via an HTMLAudioElement.
links: An article about how this came about largely due to a mistake I made.

problang.name: problang
problang.description: A small language for creating nested probability tables.

columns-within-columns.name: columns-within-columns
columns-within-columns.description: A module that will render code as columns within columns in an attempt to show how it is executed.

babysharkify.name: babysharkify
babysharkify.description: Doot doot doot do-doo do-doo! Tries to get your browser to sing arbitrary phrases to the tune of Baby Shark (with highly variable results).

get-at-path.name: get-at-path
get-at-path.description: Given an object and a keypath, gets the value at that path. e.g. Get ['countries', 'US', 'states', 'MA', 'cities', 'Somerville'] in an addresses object.

ia-upload-from-static-web-archive.name: ia-upload-from-static-web-archive
ia-upload-from-static-web-archive.description: How to upload media from a static-web-archive to the Internet Archive.

easy-browser-request.name: easy-browser-request
easy-browser-request.description: An abstraction that wraps a promise around [basic-browser-request](https://github.com/basic-browser-request) so it can be used in async/await for those that want to use async/await. It also returns the error (in the style of [https://github.com/scopsy/await-to-js](to)) as well as the response and body.

errorback-promise.name: errorback-promise
errorback-promise.description: For use with async/await patterns that immediately handle errors instead of using try/catch, wraps callback-using functions in promises that return errors in an object instead of rejecting.

randomid.name: randomid
randomid.description: This module generates random ids that can be used as DOM element ids. That's all.

space-out.name: space-out
space-out.description: Space out by listening to NASA missions and seeing space facts.

sound-of-the-far-future.name: sound-of-the-far-future
sound-of-the-far-future.description: Sonification of the Timeline of the Far Future.

one-listener-per-element.name: one-listener-per-element
one-listener-per-element.description: Single-purpose module for ensuring that DOM elements have only one event listener per element.
